parse.title: Letter to James S. Marsh (8 December 1966)

links.*: Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien

wikitext.*:
[[File:Letter to James S. Marsh - 08 December 1966 (1).jpg|thumb]] [[File:Letter to James S. Marsh - 08 December 1966 (2).jpg|thumb]] On [[8 December]] [[1966]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to James S. Marsh'''.{{webcite|articleurl=https://www.reddit.com/r/lotr/comments/wkdv6l/my_dad_was_going_through_his_recently_deceased/|articlename=My dad was going through his recently deceased brotherâ€™s correspondence and found this:|dated=9 August 2022|website=Reddit|accessed=9 August 2022}} *'''Subject:''' A reply to a letter of appreciation and three signatures on a separately enclosed sheet. *'''Publication:''' None. == Transcript == {{blockquote|Dear Mr Marsh,

Thank you for your letter. I am pleased to hear that you like my work. I am extremely busy trying to complete my next book, The Silmarillion, and I therefore enclose three autographs for you to stick into your books.

With best wishes,
Yours sincerely
J.R.R. Tolkien}} {{references}} [[Category:Letters|Marsh]]
